While national mitigation portfolios aiming at net zero
emissions or lower will need to include some
level of CDR, the choice of methods and the scale and timing of their deployment will depend on the
ambition for gross emission reductions, how sustainability and feasibility constraints are managed, and
mitigation deterrence may create further uncertainty, as anticipated future CDR could dilute incentives
Nuclear power is considered strategic for some countries, while others plan to reach their
mitigation targets without additional nuclear power
Nuclear power generation is developed in many countries, though larger
t tend to associate with significantly lower carbon emissions
